intro: Sphaerolobium validum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is often found in open woodlands and is well adapted to the dry conditions of its native habitat. Sphaerolobium validum is also a symbol of Australian identity and is widely cultivated for its ornamental value.
